text: Saeed Shehabi is a Bahraini thinker, political activist, commentator and journalist. He is a regular columnist in the daily Arabic Al-Quds newspaper.Arabic Al-Quds newspaper: http://www.alquds.co.uk/ He gives regular interviews to the BBC's Middle East Service and AlJazeera. He is also the Director of Abrar House,Abrar House: http://www.abraronline.net an Islamic community center in Central London that promotes interfaith work. He is also the leader of the pro-democractic Bahrain Freedom Movement,Bahrain Freedom Movement: http://www.vob.org that is a banned Bahraini opposition group. He was also a founding member of Al-Wefaq National Party.Al-Wefaq National Party: http://alwefaq.net/ He was previously the editor of Alalam magazine and now hosts a weekly television programme on Alalam TV.Alalam TV: http://www.alalam.ir/ He has been living in exile in London since 1979 and returned to Bahrain on two occasions in 2002. He has a PhD in engineering from City University. Saeed Shehabi is married and has seven children. On August 2010, Bahrain TV Bahrain TV: http://www.alayam.com/tv/home.htm declared that Saeed Shehabi is accused of being the second leading member of a terrorist network.Bahrain News Agency: http://english.bna.bh/?ID=89455'Terrorist Network' revealed on BTV: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fiHWKZ8L71c He is currently being tried in absentia along with Hassan Mushaimi. The Bahraini government claimed that a red notice was issued by interpol for his arrest, however this has not been verified.Daily Telegraph:Interpol Red Notice Issue:https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/bahrain/8081933/Bahrain- royal-family-facing-unprecedented-challenge-in-election.html In 1996 he was similarly sentenced to 15 years in prison in absentia.
